name: FIFA World Cup Canada - Mexico - United States 2026

hero_images.name: MetLife Stadium
hero_images.text: The final will be played at MetLife Stadium.

hero_images.name: Kylian Mbappé
hero_images.text: France forward Kylian Mbappé won the Golden Boot award after scoring eight goals in the tournament, the most since Ronaldo in 2002.

hero_images.name: Lionel Messi
hero_images.text: Argentina captain and forward Lionel Messi won the Golden Ball award, becoming the first player to win it twice.

hero_images.text: Qatar vs Ecuador

hero_images.text: England vs Iran

hero_images.name: England - Colombia
hero_images.text: Eric Dier scores the winning goal in England's first World Cup penalty shoot-out victory, having lost thrice before.

hero_images.name: James Rodríguez
hero_images.text: Golden Boot. James celebrates after scoring a penalty against Brazil at the 2014 World Cup. He became the first player to score in every single game he played since Rivaldo at the 2002 edition.

hero_images.name: Lionel Messi
hero_images.text: Golden Ball. Argentina's Lionel Messi (front) battles Germany's Mats Hummels for the ball.

hero_images.name: Paul Pogba
hero_images.text: Best Young Player

hero_images.name: Manuel Neuer
hero_images.text: Golden Glove. Neuer celebrating after Germany's 1–0 victory over Argentina in the FIFA World Cup Final.

hero_images.text: Manager Vicente del Bosque lifting the trophy with the Spanish players

hero_images.name: Spain
hero_images.text: Sergio Ramos of Spain tries to pass the ball to Fernando Torres as Portugal's Fábio Coentrão, Bruno Alves and Cristiano Ronaldo look on

hero_images.name: Final
hero_images.text: South African president Jacob Zuma and other dignitaries shaking hands with the lined-up teams before kick-off

hero_images.name: Thomas Müller
hero_images.text: Golden Boot. Best Young Player. Thomas Müller wears number 13 for Germany, a number famously worn by German legend Gerd Müller who said of his namesake; "he's going to be a great player"

hero_images.name: Diego Forlán
hero_images.text: Golden Ball. Forlán (right) with Luis Suárez at the 2010 World Cup.

hero_images.name: Iker Casillas
hero_images.text: Golden Glove. Casillas with the World Cup trophy during celebrations in Spain, July 2010.

hero_images.text: Cannavaro lifting the World Cup trophy for Italy.

hero_images.text: Lothar Matthäus scoring a penalty kick in Germany's quarter-final against Bulgaria at Giants Stadium on July 10. Bulgaria came back to win the game.

hero_images.text: From left to right: Italian manager Pozzo, Monzeglio, Bertolini, the goalkeeper and captain Combi, Monti (half-hidden) and the assistant manager Carcano (behind) before the start of extra time in the victorius final versus Czechoslovakia

hero_images.name: Round of 16
hero_images.text: Italian national soccer team players pose for a group picture, 27 May 1934 in Rome, before their World Cup round of 16 match against United States. Italy won the match beating USA 7-1. (From 2nd L : Luis Monti, Mario Pizziolo, Angelo Schiavio, Raimundo Orsi, Giovanni Ferrari, Virginio Rosetta, Giuseppe Meazza - with flag -, Giampiero Combi, Anfilogino Guarisi, Luigi Allemandi, Luigi Bertolini)
